title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 361.9 - Reporting requirements
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 361.9 - Reporting requirements

State Regulations

Each probation director shall obtain and report to the

State Director of Probation and Correctional Alternatives data on each case, as
prescribed by the State Director of Probation and Correctional Alternatives, any and all information requested pertaining to each person conditionally
released pursuant to section
70.40 (2)
of the Penal Law and under the
supervision of the probation director's department. Such information may
include, but is not limited to, information of a personal and criminal history
nature that identifies the conditional releasee, information as to his conduct, and supervision information. Such reporting shall be conducted as
follows: (a) The probation director
shall within 15 business days of notification of the conditional release, report all required information on forms as prescribed by the State Director of

Probation and Correctional Alternatives. (b) All subsequent information, including
classification information, modifications, and violation information, shall be
reported in a timely manner on forms as prescribed by the State Director of

Probation and Correctional Alternatives. (c) Terminations or expiration of conditional
release shall be recorded and reported within 20 business days as prescribed by
the State Director. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9
ยง
361.9

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
